issue.title: Improvement: Mega empty trash or hard deleting files

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi,

It would be great to have the possibility of empty the Mega trash after deleting or syncing files, or at least to have the possibility of "hard deleting" the files instead of moving it to Mega trash. 

My issue is that I have to manually empty my Mega trash two times a day because there are a lot of deleted files in it due to sync processes. If I do not do it, I will be run out of space in Mega.

Thank you for your great job!

Kind regards,

Javier

body:
We have `rclone cleanup` for emptying trash on the remote but it is not implemented for Mega. I can give it a try but it will take a few days. I'm a bit busy at the moment.

EDIT: Or it might take a few minutes... apparently didn't take long.

issue.title: mega: add cleanup support

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Fixes #3138

<!--

#### What is the purpose of this change?

Add `cleanup` support for Mega remote

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

#3138 

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).

- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

Also, I really need to remember to run golint.

body:
@gary-kim 
Sorry for missing mega cleanup!
Thanks for such fast implementation. I have already spent 10 hours trying to polish my cmd ;-(((

I am not fully knowledgeable of how this PR/releases/etc. works. When should I expect an executable having this feature? Would it be available in https://beta.rclone.org/ ?

Thanks again!
It should be available on the <https://beta.rclone.org> site once the pull request gets merged.
I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.48 - thank you very much @gary-kim

@gary-kim @ncw 
Thanks both for making this happen.

I tried the lastest beta, I must confess I am a little perplex. Even running with -vvv I got no message either from ok or not ok. So, it is a bit uncomfortable. Perhaps output could be free space before and after... So, I cannot confirm by now that works as expected.... (I will delete something and see via web interface if the command deletes trash or not...).

I would like to know about the syntax, 
https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_cleanup/ indicates that one should use remote:foder
So, for mega should I use remote:Trash ? (not written in documentation nor in mega page)
What for is needed the Folder? Perhaps it would be clearer just to provide the remote...

Last two points,

- https://rclone.org/overview/ has not carried the modification to include mega in the list of cleanup remotes.

- https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_cleanup/ : add the following info from /overview/

If the server canâ€™t do CleanUp then rclone cleanup will return an error.

> I would like to know about the syntax,
> So, for mega should I use remote:Trash ? (not written in documentation nor in mega page)

You would use cleanup with syntax such as `rclone cleanup remote:`. Whatever path you put in will be ignored.

> 
> Last two points,
> 
> * https://rclone.org/overview/ has not carried the modification to include mega in the list of cleanup remotes.

The website gets updated at every release. The change is already reflected here: <https://tip.rclone.org/overview/>. It will be on <https://rclone.org/overview/> when v1.48 is released.

@gary-kim @ncw 
I can confirm it works perfectly!
I am still uneasy at not having an explicit ok/nok response, but I imagine errorlevel is working and can be checked.
Thanks again,
CT

> @gary-kim @ncw
> I can confirm it works perfectly!
> I am still uneasy at not having an explicit ok/nok response, but I imagine errorlevel is working and can be checked.
> Thanks again,
> CT

I've stuck some logs in for -v (shows total to delete) and -vv (shows each thing to be deleted).

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins
